tech.cohorte.pinea.cipconnector.tools

Class IPAddressValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • tech.cohorte.pinea.cipconnector.tools.IPAddressValidator

  • public class IPAddressValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    T he CIPConnectionPathValidator class that performs syntax validation for cip Path. CIP path can be coposed of strictly 8 hex values otherwise it wouldn't be accepted (validated). This class uses java pattern and matcher to perform the pattern matching validation A matcher requires a path and a pattern, the pattern should be compiled with a regex expression that is created at the object construction phase. The Connection path should match the following regex pattern :

    ^([01]?\d\d?|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])\.([01]?\d\d?|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])\.([01]?\d\d?|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])\.([01]?\d\d?|2[0-4]\d|25[0-5])$

    description

    ^ Matches the beginning of the string, or the beginning of a line. This matches a position, not a character.
    ( .... ) Groups multiple tokens together and creates a capture group for extracting a substring or using a backreference.
    [ .... ] Match any character in the set.
    a - f Range Matches a character in the range "a" to "f" (char code 97 to 102). Case sensitive..
    A - F Range Matches a character in the range "A" to "F" (char code 65 to 70). Case sensitive.
    0 - 9 Ran Matches a character in the range "0" to "9" (char code 48 to 57). Case sensitive..
    {2} Quantifier Match 2 of the preceding token.
    \s whitespace Matches any whitespace character (spaces, tabs, line breaks).
    * Quantifier Match 0 or more of the preceding token.
    {8} Quantifier Match 2 of the preceding token.
    $ End Matches the end of the string, or the end of a line.
    Since:
    18/06/2020
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    MOHAMMED ELASRIs
